snippet: Mr. Choudary, who praised the perpetrators of the 9/11 terrorist attacks and refused to condemn the London subway bombings in 2005, faces 10 years in prison....
abstract: Anjem Choudary, one of Great Britain's most notorious Islamist activists, is found guilty of encouraging support for Islamic State and faces up to 10 years in prison when he is sentenced on Sept 6.
lead_paragraph: Mr. Choudary, who praised the perpetrators of the 9/11 terrorist attacks and refused to condemn the London subway bombings in 2005, faces 10 years in prison.

headline.main: Anjem Choudary, Islamist Activist in Britain, Is Convicted of Supporting ISIS
headline.print_headline: British Activist Guilty of Stirring Support for ISIS

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
